cards.name: Adamaro, First to Desire
cards.text: Adamaro, First to Desire's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the hand of the opponent with the most cards in hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beware Adamaro! In him all pain and anger is perfected."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

cards.name: Æther Shockwave
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Tap all Spirits.
• Tap all non-Spirit creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The strain upon the veil between worlds began to show near the end of the Kami War. Strange happenings that neither side could control lashed out across Kamigawa."
—Observations of the Kami War

cards.name: Akki Drillmaster
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "What part of ‘hayaku ikee!' did you not understand?"

cards.name: Akki Underling
cards.text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Akki Underling gets +2/+1 and has first strike.
cards.flavor:
"I lost my hounds in the war and thus found myself employing akki as servants. I found their training to be remarkably similar."
—Kensuke, houndmaster

cards.name: Akuta, Born of Ash
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may sacrifice a Swamp. If you do, return Akuta, Born of Ash from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Araba Mothrider
cards.text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"My finest creations are fashioned after the moths of Eiganjo. They fly higher, faster, and more gracefully than any of my own designs."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

cards.name: Arashi, the Sky Asunder
cards.text:
{X}{G}, {T}: Arashi, the Sky Asunder deals X damage to target creature with flying.
Channel — {X}{G}{G}, Discard Arashi: Arashi deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Ashes of the Fallen
cards.text:
As Ashes of the Fallen enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Each creature card in your graveyard has the chosen creature type in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: The ashes of the dead mingle with the soil, and both become as one.

cards.name: Ayumi, the Last Visitor
cards.text: Legendary landwalk
cards.flavor: Before Shinka's walls were built, before the torii at Okina stood, she was there, tall and proud against the sky, and she will be there long after they have fallen into dust.

cards.name: Barrel Down Sokenzan
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Mountains you control to their owner's hand. Barrel Down Sokenzan deals damage to target creature equal to twice the number of Mountains returned this way.

cards.name: Blood Clock
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.flavor: In an age of war, time is measured not by sand but by blood.

cards.name: Bounteous Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain life equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Even the most benevolent and life-giving of kami joined the war against the mortal world, but only with heavy and sorrowful hearts.

cards.name: Briarknit Kami
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: One thorn to warn, ten thorns to defend, a hundred thorns to destroy.

cards.name: Burning-Eye Zubera
cards.text: When Burning-Eye Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, Burning-Eye Zubera deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Captive Flame
cards.text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Kills and cooks your food in one easy stroke."

cards.name: Celestial Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: All bow at its visitation—some in awe, some in honor, some in fear.

cards.name: Charge Across the Araba
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.

cards.name: Choice of Damnations
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a number. You may have that player lose that much life. If you don't, that player sacrifices all but that many permanents.
cards.flavor:
"Life is a series of choices between bad and worse."
—Toshiro Umezawa

cards.name: Cloudhoof Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may have target player put the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Cowed by Wisdom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Curtain of Light
cards.text:
Cast Curtain of Light only during combat after blockers are declared.
Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Paint gold upon the wind,
Shape the wind into a shield,
And vanish behind the brightness."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

cards.name: Cut the Earthly Bond
cards.text: Return target enchanted permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The more kami that passed through the veil that separated them from our world, the weaker that veil became, threatening to tear into tatters at the slightest pressure."
—The History of Kamigawa

cards.name: Death Denied
cards.text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.

cards.name: Death of a Thousand Stings
cards.text:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Death of a Thousand Stings from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Deathknell Kami
cards.text:
Flying
{2}: Deathknell Kami gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
Soulshift 1 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Deathmask Nezumi
cards.text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Deathmask Nezumi gets +2/+1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"We had him cornered, we did . . . and, well, you know what they say about rats."
—Araba patrol survivor

cards.name: Dense Canopy
cards.text: Creatures with flying can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The orochi learned how to move swiftly and surely along the forest floor, like fish darting through gull-watched waters.

cards.name: Descendant of Kiyomaro
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Descendant of Kiyomaro gets +1/+2 and has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain 3 life."
cards.flavor: "The blood of Kiyomaro flows in my veins. He did not let Eiganjo fall and neither shall I."

cards.name: Descendant of Masumaro
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Descendant of Masumaro for each card in your hand, then remove a +1/+1 counter from Descendant of Masumaro for each card in target opponent's hand.

cards.name: Descendant of Soramaro
cards.text: {1}{U}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of cards in your hand, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: "Soramaro speaks through me. Listen! And I will tell the wisdom of the ancestors."

cards.name: Dosan's Oldest Chant
cards.text:
You gain 6 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: As Dosan's chant grew in volume, a second, deeper voice rose up in harmony behind it, strong enough to shake the earth and yet vibrant enough to fill the spirit.

cards.name: Dreamcatcher
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may sacrifice Dreamcatcher. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful where your mind wanders. Even in the quietest moments, the kami are listening, and your thoughts give them shape."
—Lady Azami

cards.name: Ebony Owl Netsuke
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has seven or more cards in hand, Ebony Owl Netsuke deals 4 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor:
"Owls filled the skies during the Kami War, harbingers of darker times to come."
—The History of Kamigawa

cards.name: Eiganjo Free-Riders
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a white creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The air filled with dust and the sound of wingbeats. The mothriders had joined the fray."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

cards.name: Elder Pine of Jukai
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Soulshift 2 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Endless Swarm
cards.text:
Put a 1/1 green Snake creature token onto the battlefield for each card in your hand.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability.)

cards.name: Enduring Ideal
cards.text:
Search your library for an enchantment card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability.)

cards.name: Erayo's Essence
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell for the first time in a turn, counter that spell.

cards.name: Erayo, Soratami Ascendant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever the fourth spell of a turn is cast, flip Erayo, Soratami Ascendant.

cards.name: Eternal Dominion
cards.text:
Search target opponent's library for an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

cards.name: Evermind
cards.text:
(Nonexistent mana costs can't be paid.)
Draw a card.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Exile into Darkness
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Exile into Darkness from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Feral Lightning
cards.text: Put three 3/1 red Elemental creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: They moved like apes, but a thousand times swifter, prying into every corner, leaving pawprints of ash.

cards.name: Fiddlehead Kami
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate Fiddlehead Kami.
cards.flavor:
"Like a riddle, it unwinds.
Like a green wind, it reaches out.
Like a sudden guilt, it seizes."
—Snow Fur, kitsune poet

cards.name: Footsteps of the Goryo
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: In the case of violent deaths, kami offered a chance for revenge if the deceased offered up its corpse as a host to the invading kami.

cards.name: Freed from the Real
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Tap enchanted creature.
{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: When a strong mind moves, form and energy shift to heed it.

cards.name: Gaze of Adamaro
cards.text: Gaze of Adamaro deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: Wherever it looked, it saw destruction—the wake of its own gaze.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Nourisher
cards.text:
{2}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Channel — {3}{G}, Discard Ghost-Lit Nourisher: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Raider
cards.text:
{2}{R}, {T}: Ghost-Lit Raider deals 2 damage to target creature.
Channel — {3}{R}, Discard Ghost-Lit Raider: Ghost-Lit Raider deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Redeemer
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.
Channel — {1}{W}, Discard Ghost-Lit Redeemer: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Stalker
cards.text:
{4}{B}, {T}: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
Channel — {5}{B}{B}, Discard Ghost-Lit Stalker: Target player discards four cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Warder
cards.text:
{3}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Channel — {3}{U}, Discard Ghost-Lit Warder: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.

cards.name: Glitterfang
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Glitterfang to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Through the veil's rip spilled hundreds of minor kami, rushing over the battlefield like embers from a kicked campfire. Then they were gone."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

cards.name: Gnat Miser
cards.text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one.
cards.flavor: Nezumi insect-shamans enjoyed solitary lives, which was fortunate since no other nezumi could stand to live within half a mile of their foul stench.

cards.name: Godo's Irregulars
cards.text: {R}: Godo's Irregulars deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: Godo trained their muscles and honed their skills, but he left their hearts wild and empty.

cards.name: Hail of Arrows
cards.text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

cards.name: Hand of Cruelty
cards.text:
Protection from white
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that delivers death."

cards.name: Hand of Honor
cards.text:
Protection from black
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that brings it to life."

cards.name: Haru-Onna
cards.text:
When Haru-Onna enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Haru-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Hidetsugu's Second Rite
cards.text: If target player has exactly 10 life, Hidetsugu's Second Rite deals 10 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Hidetsugu never relinquished a grudge. He let it burn within him, gathering ever greater intensity until the final moment of vengeance.

cards.name: Homura's Essence
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Homura, Human Ascendant
cards.text:
Homura, Human Ascendant can't block.
When Homura dies, return it to the battlefield flipped.

cards.name: Ideas Unbound
cards.text: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The apprentice stared in puzzlement. "But Master, you finished writing those spells just yesterday. Don't you remember?" The jushi's heart froze.

cards.name: Iizuka the Ruthless
cards.text:
Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
{2}{R}, Sacrifice a Samurai: Samurai creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Iname as One
cards.text:
When Iname as One enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, you may search your library for a Spirit permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
When Iname as One dies, you may exile it. If you do, return target Spirit permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Infernal Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The kirin bellowed—an echoing, twisted parody of its once-inspirational call.

cards.name: Inner Calm, Outer Strength
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: The ghostly objects around the kami circled faster and faster, creating a dizzying cyclone of motion. When it opened its eyes, it struck.

cards.name: Inner Fire
cards.text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Heart of Sokenzan, I call to you! Lend me your fire."

cards.name: Inner-Chamber Guard
cards.text: Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"It seems that each time I visit Lord Konda his guards are more on edge, perhaps even more eager for the war to reach them."
—Masako the Humorless

cards.name: Into the Fray
cards.text:
Target creature attacks this turn if able.
Splice onto Arcane {R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Ivory Crane Netsuke
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: It is said that the feathers of a crane are clouds, plucked and sewn together by the hands of the kami.

cards.name: Jiwari, the Earth Aflame
cards.text:
{X}{R}, {T}: Jiwari, the Earth Aflame deals X damage to target creature without flying.
Channel — {X}{R}{R}{R}, Discard Jiwari: Jiwari deals X damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Kagemaro's Clutch
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: The mist was thick, cloying, and constricting. Shiro fought his way to fresh air only to look back and see his comrades fallen on the battlefield behind him.

cards.name: Kagemaro, First to Suffer
cards.text:
Kagemaro, First to Suffer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{B}, Sacrifice Kagemaro: All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Kaho, Minamo Historian
cards.text:
When Kaho, Minamo Historian enters the battlefield, search your library for up to three instant cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
{X}, {T}: You may cast a card with converted mana cost X exiled with Kaho without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Kami of Empty Graves
cards.text: Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

cards.name: Kami of the Tended Garden
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kami of the Tended Garden unless you pay {G}.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Kashi-Tribe Elite
cards.text:
Legendary Snakes you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Elite deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Kataki, War's Wage
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."
cards.flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

cards.name: Kemuri-Onna
cards.text:
When Kemuri-Onna enters the battlefield, target player discards a card.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kemuri-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Kiku's Shadow
cards.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"Me? No, I'm not going to kill you. I won't even lay a finger on you. I promise."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

cards.name: Kiri-Onna
cards.text:
When Kiri-Onna enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kiri-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Kitsune Bonesetter
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Activate this ability only if you have more cards in hand than each opponent.
cards.flavor:
"He kept generations whole before the Kami War, and now he turns his century of wisdom to healing the latest casualties."
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

cards.name: Kitsune Dawnblade
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Kitsune Dawnblade enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Kitsune Loreweaver
cards.text: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."

cards.name: Kiyomaro, First to Stand
cards.text:
Kiyomaro, First to Stand's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
As long as you have four or more cards in hand, Kiyomaro has vigilance.
Whenever Kiyomaro deals damage, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 7 life.

cards.name: Kuon's Essence
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Kuon, Ogre Ascendant
cards.text: At the beginning of the end step, if three or more creatures died this turn, flip Kuon, Ogre Ascendant.

cards.name: Kuro's Taken
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Kuro's Taken.
cards.flavor: Simple bargains are the most tempting, and oni bargains are the simplest of all: eternal life for eternal service.

cards.name: Locust Miser
cards.text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by two.
cards.flavor: "They're numerous, attack in swarms, and are always hungry. No wonder we rats hold such a kinship with them."

cards.name: Maga, Traitor to Mortals
cards.text:
Maga, Traitor to Mortals enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Maga enters the battlefield, target player loses life equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Manriki-Gusari
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has "{T}: Destroy target Equipment."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Masumaro, First to Live
cards.text: Masumaro, First to Live's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor:
"In the waning moments of war, humanity's most ancient ancestors return. But whose side shall they make their own?"
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

cards.name: Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker
cards.text:
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{G}: Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Measure of Wickedness
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Measure of Wickedness and you lose 8 life.
Whenever another card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, target opponent gains control of Measure of Wickedness.

cards.name: Meishin, the Mind Cage
cards.text: All creatures get -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: It's dangerous indeed to be lost in someone else's thoughts.

cards.name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
cards.text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, that player sacrifices a permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
—Michiko Konda, last letter to General Takeno

cards.name: Mikokoro, Center of the Sea
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Each player draws a card.
cards.flavor:
"Center of the Sea, Eye of the World, Shrine of Enlightenment. Seek it for answers. Seek it for healing. Seek it and return transformed."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Minamo

cards.name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.
cards.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

cards.name: Miren, the Moaning Well
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Molting Skin
cards.text: Return Molting Skin to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: "We have learned much from the orochi."

cards.name: Moonbow Illusionist
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Moonwing Moth
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Moonwing Moth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Night wings sprinkled with dust
Of a thousand soldiers dead
And a thousand cities fallen."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

cards.name: Murmurs from Beyond
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. An opponent chooses one of them. Put that card into your graveyard and the rest into your hand.
cards.flavor: Like pools of fog that hid treacherous rocks from sailors' eyes, so too were the hands of the kami.

cards.name: Neverending Torment
cards.text:
Search target player's library for X cards, where X is the number of cards in your hand, and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

cards.name: Nightsoil Kami
cards.text: Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Nikko-Onna
cards.text:
When Nikko-Onna enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Nikko-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: O-Naginata
cards.text:
O-Naginata can be attached only to a creature with power 3 or greater.
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Oboro Breezecaller
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Untap target land.
cards.flavor:
"I feel their unnatural influence in the weary, weeping land. Do they care nothing for the creatures who walk below their clouds?"
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

cards.name: Oboro Envoy
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Oboro, Palace in the Clouds
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{1}: Return Oboro, Palace in the Clouds to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Here the soratami wove their endless plots—graceful, artful, and deceitful, while the unwitting world moved below.

cards.name: Okina Nightwatch
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Okina Nightwatch gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.

cards.name: One with Nothing
cards.text: Discard your hand.
cards.flavor: When nothing remains, everything is equally possible.

cards.name: Oni of Wild Places
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a red creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The oni leapt easily from peak to peak, toying with its victims, its voice a purr from the rumbling depths of nightmare.

cards.name: Oppressive Will
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

cards.name: Overwhelming Intellect
cards.text: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "My brain hurts."

cards.name: Pain's Reward
cards.text: Each player may bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of any number. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and draws four cards.

cards.name: Path of Anger's Flame
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Walking the path of the kami only leaves you with singed feet."
—Soratami saying

cards.name: Pithing Needle
cards.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

cards.name: Plow Through Reito
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.
cards.flavor: The paths of the kami crisscrossed Kamigawa like scars left by a maddened surgeon.

cards.name: Presence of the Wise
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Humbly I bow. Silently I wait. Deeply I listen."

cards.name: Promise of Bunrei
cards.text: When a creature you control dies, sacrifice Promise of Bunrei. If you do, put four 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "I am not afraid to die today nor afraid of what death will bring."

cards.name: Promised Kannushi
cards.text: Soulshift 7 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Pure Intentions
cards.text:
Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard cards this turn, return those cards from your graveyard to your hand.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Pure Intentions, return Pure Intentions from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Rally the Horde
cards.text: Exile the top card of your library. Exile the top card of your library. Exile the top card of your library. If the last card exiled isn't a land, repeat this process. Put a 1/1 red Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each nonland card exiled this way.

cards.name: Raving Oni-Slave
cards.text: When Raving Oni-Slave enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, you lose 3 life if you don't control a Demon.

cards.name: Razorjaw Oni
cards.text: Black creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: It gnashed its teeth, and the battlefield filled with the screech of blade striking blade.

cards.name: Reki, the History of Kamigawa
cards.text: Whenever you cast a legendary spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"After his death, monks spent ten years transcribing the tattoos from Reki's body and gathering stories from those who spoke with him. Thus the volume you hold was written."
—The History of Kamigawa

cards.name: Rending Vines
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Reverence
cards.text: Creatures with power 2 or less can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Despite the massive forces that allied against him, Konda never once believed he would lose the Kami War."
—Masako the Humorless

cards.name: Ronin Cavekeeper
cards.text: Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: The akki were surprised to encounter a human who could fight in the caves as well as they.

cards.name: Rune-Tail's Essence
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control.

cards.name: Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant
cards.text: When you have 30 or more life, flip Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant.

cards.name: Rushing-Tide Zubera
cards.text: When Rushing-Tide Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Cut off from the kakuriyo by the destruction of their honden, the zubera sought new ways to bring their secrets home.

cards.name: Sakashima the Impostor
cards.text: You may have Sakashima the Impostor enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except its name is still Sakashima the Impostor, it's legendary in addition to its other types, and it gains "{2}{U}{U}: Return Sakashima the Impostor to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step."

cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Scout
cards.text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Scouts of the Sakura Tribe spent two years wandering the forest to learn every leaf and tree. That knowledge was called upon during the Kami War to ensure the orochi's survival."
—The History of Kamigawa

cards.name: Sasaya's Essence
cards.text: Whenever a land you control is tapped for mana, for each other land you control with the same name, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Sasaya, Orochi Ascendant
cards.text: Reveal your hand: If you have seven or more land cards in your hand, flip Sasaya, Orochi Ascendant.

cards.name: Scroll of Origins
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card if you have seven or more cards in hand.
cards.flavor: The words from which language sprang, the knowledge from which thought was born, the story from which history was woven.

cards.name: Secretkeeper
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Secretkeeper gets +2/+2 and has flying.
cards.flavor: It is all the things that humanity was not meant to know.

cards.name: Seed the Land
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, its controller puts a 1/1 green Snake creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: With a sadness and a sense of hope, Senka left the colony of her birth and, with her attendants, set out to serve as broodmistress, founder of a new colony.

cards.name: Seek the Horizon
cards.text: Search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen this great land from every angle. I know its every tree, stone, and river bend. Yet I have come to realize that knowing a thing is not the same as healing it."
—Diary of Azusa

cards.name: Sekki, Seasons' Guide
cards.text:
Sekki, Seasons' Guide enters the battlefield with eight +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Sekki, prevent that damage, remove that many +1/+1 counters from Sekki, and put that many 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice eight Spirits: Return Sekki from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Shape Stealer
cards.text: Whenever Shape Stealer blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Shape Stealer has base power and toughness equal to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Stand back. I know just what to do."
—Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker

cards.name: Shifting Borders
cards.text:
Exchange control of two target lands.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Shinen of Fear's Chill
cards.text:
Shinen of Fear's Chill can't block.
Channel — {1}{B}, Discard Shinen of Fear's Chill: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Shinen of Flight's Wings
cards.text:
Flying
Channel — {U}, Discard Shinen of Flight's Wings: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Shinen of Fury's Fire
cards.text:
Haste
Channel — {R}, Discard Shinen of Fury's Fire: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Shinen of Life's Roar
cards.text:
All creatures able to block Shinen of Life's Roar do so.
Channel — {2}{G}{G}, Discard Shinen of Life's Roar: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

cards.name: Shinen of Stars' Light
cards.text:
First strike
Channel — {1}{W}, Discard Shinen of Stars' Light: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Sink into Takenuma
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Swamps you control to their owner's hand. Target player discards a card for each Swamp returned this way.

cards.name: Skull Collector
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a black creature you control to its owner's hand.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Skull Collector.
cards.flavor: "Your blood I'll use. Your skull I'll keep."

cards.name: Skyfire Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain control of target creature with that spell's converted mana cost until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its fiery visitation burns away the fog of war and dissipates the ties of loyalty.

cards.name: Sokenzan Renegade
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more cards in hand than each other player, the player who has the most cards in hand gains control of Sokenzan Renegade.

cards.name: Sokenzan Spellblade
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{R}: Sokenzan Spellblade gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Soramaro, First to Dream
cards.text:
Flying
Soramaro, First to Dream's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{4}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card.

cards.name: Soratami Cloud Chariot
cards.text:
{2}: Target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.
{2}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control this turn.

cards.name: Spiraling Embers
cards.text: Spiraling Embers deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: The akki knew to stay indoors on the days the oni flew their kites.

cards.name: Spiritual Visit
cards.text:
Put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token onto the battlefield.
Splice onto Arcane {W} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Stampeding Serow
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sunder from Within
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor: Trapped for eons within the sacred gong, the kami boomed and clanged to a deafening tempo as they destroyed their erstwhile prison.

cards.name: Thoughts of Ruin
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a land for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor:
"In our war with the kami, we annihilate what is our own. Do they too suffer ruination in their hidden world?"
—Diary of Azusa

cards.name: Tomb of Urami
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Tomb of Urami deals 1 damage to you if you don't control an Ogre.
{2}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice all lands you control: Put a legendary 5/5 black Demon Spirit creature token with flying named Urami onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Torii Watchward
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Trusted Advisor
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by two.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Some of Minamo's students claimed he was as old as the knowledge he dispensed.

cards.name: Twincast
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you have to search for inspiration, and sometimes it's right there in front of you.

cards.name: Undying Flames
cards.text:
Exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card. Undying Flames deals damage to target creature or player equal to that card's converted mana cost.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

cards.name: Wine of Blood and Iron
cards.text: {4}: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. Sacrifice Wine of Blood and Iron at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Godo never revealed what went into his special brew, but he always had more of it after great victories.

cards.name: Yuki-Onna
cards.text:
When Yuki-Onna enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Yuki-Onna to its owner's hand.
